metadata.title: CVE-2016-10198 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The gst_aac_parse_sink_setcaps function in gst/audioparsers/gstaacparse.cin gst-plugins-good in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (invalid memory read and crash) via a craftedaudio file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-gconf - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
gstreamer0.10-plugins-good - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
gstreamer0.10-pulseaudio - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.3').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.4').
